Don’t sit on the bench, drop your gloves and come and get it!

24656.name: Stories from DC, not Washington
24656.description: After four years of telling true tales of dust & glory in the Capital, DC area Burners are taking the stage in Black Rock City. Come hear autobiographical stories about how people who live, work, and play in DC bring a bit of that Playa magic and the Ten Principles into their lives and communities, because there's a completely different city from the Washington you might know.

24657.name: Playawear 911: Reparo Fabulosa
24657.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 10 a.m. – 3 p.m.
Monday, August 28th, 2017 10 a.m. – 3 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 10 a.m. – 3 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 10 a.m. – 3 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 10 a.m. – 3 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 10 a.m. – 3 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 10 a.m. – 3 p.m.
24657.description: Need help with your radical self-expression? Did your latest dust-up result in a rip, tear, or busted seam?  Are your britches bothersome or your camelback chaffing?  Do you just want to be creative in the shade for a while? Come on down to camp Yes Please at 8:00 & Eulogy,  sip something cool, and get craftsy with us. Whether you are simply in need of a needle and thread for radical self-repairs or everything is falling apart beyond your skill set, we're here to help. Our Big Box o' Dreams (Fabric Division) is stocked with the supplies you need to repair your playawear or finish that not-quite-playa-ready outfit. We're open anytime for self-fixes. If your gear is good, stop in and rummage through our treasure chest of trinkets to create your own playa-inspired jewelry.  Ask for Stitch or Mariposa for advice and assistance.

24658.name: Gnomish Elixir Mixer
24658.description: Bring your mischievous enthusiasm for an all-new celebratory ritual uniting our species. Newly adopted gnomes encouraged!

24659.name: Gnome Adoptions (Kid Friendly!)
24659.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 3:30 p.m. – 5:30 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 3:30 p.m. – 5:30 p.m.
24659.description: Do you have a gnome-sized hole in your family? Our adoption ceremony will determine the most qualified homes for orphaned Gnomes.

24660.name: Terrible Tarot
24660.description: De-mystify your future with our guru psychic, Jessica Talbot, as she inaccurately and inexpertly reads tarot cards passed down from generation to generation. She welcomes all individuals, couples and random BRC citizens that may be standing too close to each other. Wild tales of divinity and awe will be told, to make even the most simple question a series of mystical bullshit, and inspire even the most hardened road warrior or ripper lover. See your dystopian future before it arrives!!!

24661.name: Hookah Hour at an authentic Bedouin tent.
24661.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 2 p.m. – 4 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 2 p.m. – 4 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 2 p.m. – 4 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 2 p.m. – 4 p.m.
24661.description:
Relax, pull up a cushion and settle in for a spell in an authentic Desert to Desert Bedouin tent. 

Fill the air with the sweet smells of hookah and conversation. Let the scents of rosewater, cardamom, burning rosewood and frankincense mixed with softly playing Arabian music carry you from one desert to another. Hot and cold chai are served daily along with Arabic sweets and dried fruits.

24662.name: Water Calligraphy
24662.description:
Ephemeral- lasting a very short time; shortlived;
transitory. Join us for a workshop where
the project lasts but minute, yet the experience
will leave an indelible mark on your soul.
Enjoy authentic iced or hot Chai served in a Bedouin café afterwards.

24663.name: Hugging Workshop
24663.description: Explore 25 different ways to hug. Get ready for pats, taps, squeezes and bear hug grunts. Hugging is an extremely positive form of communication. It expresses the values of love, approval, gratitude, and forgiveness. Hugging is a great form of emotional satisfaction, but with some surprising health benefits. Enjoy authentic iced or hot Chai served in a Bedouin café afterwards.

24664.name: Poi & Flow Arts Playshop
24664.description:
Flow Art encompasses an array of circus performance
arts such as juggling, poi, staff, hoop,
levi wand and more! Come by the workshop and
work on your desired prop or just come by and
flow with us! BYOP (Bring Your Own Prop). Enjoy authentic iced or hot Chai served in a Bedouin café afterwards.

24665.name: Playa Seals Art Tour
24665.description:
Fact: Playa Seals love ART ART ART! Meet
at camp Spice N Vice for the seals signature
cocktail- Kiss From a Rose. Come in your best
seal disguise. We will ride together to various
art pieces to sunbathe and frolic.

24666.name: Arabic Calligraphy & Tattoo Art
24666.description:
Give us a word, statement, name or anything with spiritual significance.... we’ll translate it
and shape it into Arabic Calligraphy for you and draw it on your body. Rumi would be proud! Enjoy authentic iced or hot Chai served in a Bedouin café afterwards.

24667.name: Hooping 101 Playshop
24667.description:
Do you wanna go the party? Come show us your party moves! Oh wait, what party are you going to? We here at Spice and Vice want to spice up your party moves so
you can shake those hips all the way to the party and beyond. Come let us help you hoop your way to the party you want to go to. Virgin with a hoop or experienced
with years, our hooping class we’ll show you how to move that hoop on body and off body and will ensure you get your vice from the party. BYOH (Bring Your Own Hoop). Enjoy authentic iced or hot Chai served in a Bedouin café afterwards.

24668.name: Storytelling
24668.description:
One day, while walking along a well-trodden path, you
came across a tent in the desert. Intrigued by its glimmering
exterior and needing to escape the brutal sun,
you entered. You, weary traveler, were served chai and
while you drank you were captivated by the stories that
were told by fellow travelers. The myth and misadventures
they had seen. You, moved by their stories, told a
tale that left the whole tent in awe. You were glad that
you had wandered into Spice and Vice for this story slam.

24669.name: Regional Community Building Workshop
24669.description:
Shanghai Regional Coordinator and Dragon Burn organizers
will present images and stories from Asia’s regional, Dragon
Burn. They will provide insight into the regional network,
the challenges and joys of starting a regional burn, comparisons
to the big burn in BRC, and lead a discussion of on how
to grow your regional community.

24670.name: Release Your Inner Arab
24670.description:
We are traders, merchants and travelers from across the
Arabian Peninsula- settling on the tiny desert island of Bahrain.
We’ve come to share our gifts and stories with you....
and teach you a bit about our eclectic culture. Join us for
some rosewater vodka shots, belly dancin’ booty shakin’ to
some tribal tunes and Arabic language course 101!

24671.name: Radical inclusion VR workshop/meetup
24671.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
24671.description:
VR first-timer? Or seasoned pro? Wanna jump in and help us build a global network of content from regional burns and carry the impact beyond the playa?

Camp VRC, part of Martini Village, is all about capturing and sharing the Burning Man experience. Radical inclusion, virtual reality (VR) style. Lose yourself in an experience from last year's Burn. Play with us as we imagine and capture experiences from this year's Burn to take back to the default world!

Tuesday & Thursday, 5-6pm. Meet up in the shade of the martini bar. Yup: on the corner with the giant flaming martini glass.  =]

24672.name: Ask a drunk scientist!
24672.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m.
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 6:30 p.m.
24672.description: Stop by and ask your most nagging questions about the Universe, the Earth, the Playa, the brain, the body, your mental state, and whatever else you may be curious about... While the answers might not be as simple as you would wish, we'll definitely enjoy discussing and drinking together! We promise that if you don’t leave our camp smarter at least you’ll be drunker.

24673.name: Heavenly Yoga
24673.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 10:30 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 10:30 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 10:30 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 10:30 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 10:30 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
24673.description: Sleep off that hangover and enjoy a yoga class at a suitable time after coffee and bacon and dancing in the morning sun. We will promise that you will depart from tightness and arrive in a state of bliss! The sensitivity we develop on our yoga mats effects everybody around us. Slowly yogi by yogini we can shift the direction the world is taking.

24674.name: Handjobs
24674.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
24674.description: Back by popular demand, Enchanted Handjobs. Hand massage and tête-à-tête with camp ShangriLa are scheduled Monday & Wednesday from 2-3pm. Discover the delights and deep relaxation of a hand massage. Coconut oil is used to lubricate and soften the hands while our mystic healers work away your troubles and cares using a combination of techniques along with the right amount of pressure. Last year over 100 attended and we had people literally purring in our hands. Stop by and explore this amazing treat for yourself at ShangriLa! You will receive and give a Handjob! The best free gift for you and your playa friends is a hand massage. Our hands do a lot of work from the minute we wake up until we go to bed. When was the last time you gave a loved one a gentle hand massage? It always surprises people when they discover the delights and deep relaxation of a hand massage. Come and explore this amazing treat for yourself and others @ ShangriLa!

24675.name: Wine Tasting @ Weinkeller ShangriLaLa
24675.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
24675.description: Our established ShangriLaLa Weinkeller will have wine tastings every evening for your enjoyment @ 5:30pm. On Tuesday night camp members (known as LaLas) are asked to dress in formal attire. If you like to contribute, bring on Tuesday night a bottle of your favorite wine and wine glass as well. On Wednesday night, Shangri-Naughty will return...We will throw in a little flogging with a cat-o-nine tails and it will be a night to remember. In Vino Veritas - in Wine lies the truth. There are four (4) recognized stages to wine tastings: Appearance, The Aroma of the Wine, Sensations of the Mouth and The Finish (aftertaste). Please make sure you have your ID ready - you have to be twenty-one (21) years old to drink @ ShangriLaLa. We will check your ID - Namaste.

24676.name: Consult the Pythia at the Oracle of Blackrock
24676.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 noon – 5 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 noon – 5 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 noon – 5 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 noon – 5 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 noon – 5 p.m.
24676.description: In ancient times, pilgrims endured great challenges to seek an audience with the Pythia, the Oracle of Delphi.  Now YOU, Burning pilgrim,  having overcome GREAT OBSTACLES, may consult the Pythia at Blackrock!  She performs rites and rituals to obtain wisdom & clarity, exorcism & liberation and forgiveness & integration.  One-on-one individualized attention...first come, first served!  But be prepared...you may only ask once!

24677.name: Sexy Snow Cones
24677.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 1 p.m. – 4 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 1 p.m. – 4 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 1 p.m. – 4 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 1 p.m. – 4 p.m.
24677.description: Come have a Sexy Snow Cone on a Hot Dusty Day at Risa! We have all the Dirty Flavors a Risian could ever want with a Kool lounge to enjoy it in.

24678.name: White Wabbit Wednesday Dance Party
24678.description: Wind up (or down) your White Wednesday in style at a a twilight, Parov-inspired, international dance soiree. Come play with the Shack To-Hell-U-Ride and take home your best memory of BRC.

24679.name: The Legal Strategy to Defend Standing Rock
24679.description: Chase and Danny will explain the legal strategy to defend water protectors at Standing Rock. They will address the importance of divestment from the Dakota Access Pipeline, the spiritual basis of the environmental crisis, and the role of politics and organizing and securing justice for Native communities. These two internationally-known lawyers will announce a call to action: petitioning the North Dakota Attorney General to drop charges against all water protectors and instead file charges against Tiger Swan, the private security company operating without a permit at Standing Rock, identifying water protectors as similar to "jihadist terrorists", and colluding with state and federal law enforcement to violate the civil rights of peaceful protestors.

24680.name: The Legal Strategy to Defend Standing Rock
24680.description: Chase and Danny will explain the legal strategy to defend water protectors at Standing Rock. They will address the importance of divestment from the Dakota Access Pipeline, the spiritual basis of the environmental crisis, and the role of politics and organizing and securing justice for Native communities. These two internationally-known lawyers will announce a call to action: petitioning the North Dakota Attorney General to drop charges against all water protectors and instead file charges against Tiger Swan, the private security company operating without a permit at Standing Rock, identifying water protectors as similar to "jihadist terrorists", and colluding with state and federal law enforcement to violate the civil rights of peaceful protestors.

24681.name: Ecovillage Living &Movement Towards Tribal Society
24681.description: Community living and transformational experiences - via plant medicine, gatherings, and meditation - are two ways that humans are resurrecting ancestral traditions.  David will share an overview of his work in building a regenerative culture. Through technology, love, and resurrecting tribal systems, he is helping to build a global community of transformational living centers connected together by modern nomadic tribes.

24682.name: Kava Moment
24682.description: Authentic Kava ceremony as practiced in Fiji.  Sit, relax, and get mellow before you head out to the Playa!  OR, stay for the Dream Igniter Ritual: Ignite your lifelong dream through your own focus, artistry and musical inspiration

24683.name: Dream Igniter Ritual
24683.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
24683.description: Ignite your lifelong dream through your own focus, artistry and musical inspiration. Come early and get mellow at the authentic Fiji Kava Ceremony.

24684.name: Standing Rock at BRC: Justice for Water Protectors
24684.description: Lakota People’s Law Project attorneys Chase Iron Eyes and and Daniel Sheehan will discuss the current strategy to win justice for Standing Rock water protectors falsely charged with crimes. They will also lay out strategies for divesting from the Dakota Access pipeline and organizing to heal the Earth and secure justice for Native communities.

24685.name: Spousal Obligations
24685.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 midnight – 11:45 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 midnight – 11:45 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 midnight – 11:45 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 midnight – 11:45 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 midnight – 11:45 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 midnight – 11:45 p.m.
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 midnight – 11:45 p.m.
24685.description: Sometimes supporting your partners dreams sucks. Let's all get out there and give these poor souls some love. Dancing alone to your partners DJ set all by yourself is as much fun as it looks. Put your ear plugs in and give some hugs, drinks, something, anything. They are fucking troopers

24686.name: The Art of Anal: 6 Steps to a Hole New World
24686.description: I talk to couples all of the time about their failed attempts at anal sex. Even gay guys don’t have it all figured out - some think they’ll never enjoy bottoming! And shockingly, getting drunk, sticking it in, and hoping things will just work out is *not* a successful strategy. Regardless if you’re a straight, gay, bi, trans, or any other type of couple - there are probably tips and tricks you can share and learn with others that want to perfect the art of anal. Come solo or bring your partner, questions, and stories for a backdoor discussion of the 6 steps to succeeding at anal.

24687.name: Overlanding; vehicle living tips
24687.description:
Overlanding (travelling by van, truck or small RV) is gaining popularity once again as it offers flexibility, simplicity and security. Living in a vehicle has it's challenges but are a great way to practice radical self-reliance, radical self-expression and leaving no trace. Meet Kerri and Cadillac as they share their experiences living in a van.
30-min talk + Q&A. Hibernaculum Camp, 6:30nearE.

24688.name: My Journey with Mary Magdalene
24688.description: How Mary Magdalene's archetype is being born again through women all over the world today, and an exploration of Josie's personal transformation.

24689.name: 5Rhythms Dance w/Chloe Goodwin @ RhythmWave
24689.description: The 5Rhythms is a body based awareness practice rooted in the notion that if you put the psyche in motion, it will heal itself. The 5Rhythms are: Flowing, Staccato, Chaos, Lyrical, and Stillness. Together these rhythms form a cycle of energy, patterned after the way all things move and change. When we sync up with this cycle, we integrate the wild, wide-ranging scope of who we are and how life moves through us. Movement is the medicine, the metaphor, and the meditation. Our dance becomes the ritual that calls all the pieces of us back into one unified being loving knowing seeing healing whole. All are invited to join Chloe Goodwin for this 5Rhythms dance medicine movement ritual at RhythmWave!

24690.name: Othermindfulness: A Practice for Connecting
24690.description: A talk on shared experiences, connection, & othermindfulness, & how we can move forward into a better world with some conscious reframing.

24691.name: Tuesday and Thursday Tranquility @ Dusk
24691.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 5 p.m. – 6 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 5 p.m. – 6 p.m.
24691.description:
* Tea Ceremony with Fresh Steamed Playa Cakes
* Location: 8:00/E, under our aerial art piece, Apparent Horizon-Silver Cord

24692.name: Space Gnomes Sound Bar
24692.time:
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
24692.description: Come on down to the Space Gnome Dome to have some intergalactic drinks and dance to our outta this world DJs.

24693.name: Burlesque La Femme - ONE WWOMAN SHOW
24693.description: A BURLESQUE, ONE WOMAN SHOW, PERFORMED BY LA FEMME RIKITA SHOWING THE SENSUAL SIDE OF MOVEMENT AND DANCE-ART FORM TIME PERIODS FROM 1920S TO CURRENT.

24694.name: SOUND HEALING AND PARTNER YOGA- Earth Zone
24694.description: Use your voice, vibration and asana to feel the bliss on the playa as you explore grounding partner yoga.  Please bring mat and instruments.

24695.name: LITTERALLY - WORLD CLASS COCKTAILS
24695.description:
4 to 8PM Monday to Friday:
The cocktails we will be making have been designed by new <<GRAVITY>> member Nicolas De Soto. Nico is a first timer at Burning Man, long time friend who was this last weekend competing in quarter finals at the Tales of the Cocktails in NoLa for the 3 most prestigious categories in this world wide event: Best Bar tender / Most creative cocktail list in the world / Best New Bar in the World. 
We are looking forward to offering cocktails to anyone curious, from a top class talent in our Gaterade coolers !!

24696.name: LeTITSNOW
24696.description: Cosmic Ranch and Camp Random Pants join forces to bring you a Christmas themed party with Scottie Scribbles and Mr. Bremson on the decks. Please dress XXXMas as there will be a red carpet and walk off! Feel free to bring decor, libations, or Christmas themed treats!

24697.name: Brand-UR-Ass N More
24697.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 2 p.m. – 5 p.m.
24697.description: Brand-UR-Ass 'N More will stimulate your entire being, from your mind to your ass. Bare your butt at the hitchin post and get a temporary brand. Bathe in gong vibrations, do some cock ropin', enjoy tunes, belly up to the saloon, enjoy the giving tree and hitch a ride on our vehicles. Y'all come N play!

24698.name: BASICS OF KETO & KETO HAPPY HOUR
24698.description:
Want to drop 50 lbs? Want a six pack abs? Want to lower your blood pressure? It's all not only possible, but very easily done, once you master the basics of the ketogenic diet. Kamp Keto is  the one stop on the playa for burners seeking the next level of body efficiency.

In our comfortable shaded tent, we'll be hosting a series of lectures by world renowned medical biohacker Toni Bark, MD,  from basics of Keto to The Big Food Smackdown; How Big Food is killing you and what you can do about it.

Following each lecture, we'll be hosting our Happy Hour (21+ only), serving our signature Kito-ritas (Margaritas).  Did you know that the average Margarita using a pre-made mix is 510 calories, 400 of that from sugar? That's ½ cup of sugar in just one drink. Come listen, ask questions, and have a cocktail!

24699.name: HOW TO KETO YOUR KITCHEN & KETO HAPPY HOUR
24699.description:
Want to drop 50 lbs? Want a six pack abs? Want to lower your blood pressure? It's all not only possible, but very easily done, once you master the basics of the ketogenic diet. Kamp Keto is  the one stop on the playa for burners seeking the next level of body efficiency.

In our comfortable shaded tent, we'll be hosting a series of lectures by world renowned medical biohacker Toni Bark, MD,  from basics of Keto to The Big Food Smackdown; How Big Food is killing you and what you can do about it.

Following each lecture, we'll be hosting our Happy Hour (21+ only), serving our signature Kito-ritas (Margaritas).  Did you know that the average Margarita using a pre-made mix is 510 calories, 400 of that from sugar? That's ½ cup of sugar in just one drink. Come listen, ask questions, and have a cocktail!

24701.name: Gong meditation
24701.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 a.m.
24701.description: Come bathe in the glorious vibrations of the gongs.

24702.name: Soul Train Party
24702.description: Come dance to the soulful 70’s sounds in your afros, bell bottoms and tube tops. Let’s form the playa’s longest ever sooooouuuullll train line.

24703.name: Quesadilla's and Michelada's at Real Dilla!
24703.description: Swing by for a hot, melty Quesadilla and a cold, spicy Michelada! We serve them up right and we do it fast. Theres a full bar and sound system so you you can dance while you imbibe. We will be serving most nights but Tues and Thurs from 9pm-12am for sure. Bar (Mex beer, or any beer in particular) and quesadilla donations always appreciated!

24704.name: Quesadilla's and Michelada's at Real Dilla!
24704.description: Swing by for a hot, melty Quesadilla and a cold, spicy Michelada! We serve them up right and we do it fast. Theres a full bar and sound system so you you can dance while you imbibe. We will be serving most nights but Tues and Thurs from 9pm-12am for sure. Bar (Mex beer, or any beer in particular) and quesadilla donations always appreciated!

24705.name: Gigsville Branding Hour
24705.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 4 p.m. – 5 p.m.
24705.description: We'll provide the hot coals and big iron brands, you provide the flesh!  The brands will be left on the CarBQ, feel free to use them yourself, bring a friend, or find a willing villain to help out!

24706.name: WHEEL OF HAM!
24706.description: A smack in the ass! An imported jeweled watch!  A wet fur ball to the face!  A little dusty pussy, or a HAM!  One of these could be yours!  Come and spin the Wheel of Ham™!

24707.name: Grateful Dead Dance Party!
24707.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
Monday, August 28th, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 11 a.m. – 11:45 p.m.
24707.description: Cut a rug to the Grateful Dead all day and night at the Brokedown Palace--an interactive Grateful Dead theme camp. We'll be rocking every day, Sunday til Sunday from around 11 am to 4 am, perhaps even earlier or later! Underneath our 40'x40' pole tent we play Dead tunes almost all day (11 am to 4 am at least), allowing Burners to come in and dance on the dance floor or to get out of the heat and relax in our ample lounge area that's filled with comfy chairs and sofas and decorated with a relaxed bohemian vibe. Enjoy an ice cold beer or a made-to-order cocktail, day or night. We've got a great sound system and an endless supply of live Dead recordings. We have a full stage setup for impromptu live performances--all you need to bring is your talent!

24708.name: Get tuned in & unleash your inner artist
24708.description: Creative self expression should be spontaneous and free! Let's Sketch together. Fear not, come & discover your inner artist.

24709.name: Body Games & the Alexander Technique
24709.description: Neck, shoulders, back stiffness? Come experience how the AT can help! This is a hands-on, non-manipulative technique that helps develop awareness of how we use our body in any activity we do. Does wonders for postural issues! Actors, musicians, dancers have used it for over 100 years. Bring a yoga mat.

24710.name: Deep House Yoga and Dance
24710.description: What's better than playa yoga? How about shaded vinyasa flow to the continuous, soulful build of deep house that inspires you to dance too?? BYO Mat.

24711.name: Awful Waffles at the Awful House
24711.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 9 a.m. – 11 a.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 9 a.m. – 11 a.m.
24711.description: Satisfy your desire with waffles fresh from the fire - Awful Waffles, that is. Get 'em while they're hot, top 'em like they're absolutely not! A trip through the queue gets a stop at the FUNishment bar too.

24712.name: Awful Waffle Cruise-In at the Awful House
24712.description: Satisfy your desire with waffles fresh from the fire - Awful Waffles, that is. Get 'em while they're hot, top 'em like they're absolutely not! A trip through the queue gets a stop at the FUNishment bar too. Free parking for art cars... if you can find a spot.

24713.name: VENO Happy Hour
24713.description: Brian Eno + “V” Bands = VENO Happy Hour. Wine served for 21+ @ Never Never Camp 3:45 & E"

24714.name: A Journey Back Home
24714.description: Join us on a journey of discovering and unleashing your true self through movement, meditation, & conversation. Discover what blocks you from being unapologetically YOU and learn to celebrate all that you are.

24729.description:
Don’t know the difference between an f-stop and a bus stop? Drop by and have our experts show you how to get the most out of your camera. Then practice your skills on our short photo obstacle course, and earn a drink that will leave all your photos looking pleasantly soft and fuzzy. 
Hibernaculum Camp on 6:30@E.

24730.name: Cheng Style Baguazhang: Intro to Turning Palms
24730.description:
Condensed beginner-introduction into fundamental palm changes for Cheng Style Baguazhang. Baguazhang serves as one of the primary traditional internal martial arts, sharing with Tai Chi and Xing Yi. Alongside some bagua basics and distinctions of Cheng style over other styles of bagua, this session will focus on the Old 8 Turning Palms, based on the core Mother Palms in the Cheng style. Any levels of experience and skill in the martial arts are welcome, including those who haven’t had any!
Hibernaculum Camp on 6:30@E.

24731.name: Cheng Style Baguazhang: Intro to Mother Palms
24731.description:
Condensed beginner-introduction into the Mother Palms of Cheng Style Baguazhang. The Mother Palms are considered core and foundational practices for dynamically conditioning the body and mind for not only for martial development, but as importantly, wellness and awareness. Our session together will include bagua basics (specific to the Cheng style) to get us walking the circle and techniques that go into the practice of the Mother Palms. Any levels of martial arts experience, including none at all, are welcome and encouraged!
Hibernaculum Camp on 6:30@E.

24732.name: Mindfulness: Not That Hippy Bullshit
24732.description:
Come join an open conversation focused on human responsibility and giving a shit. Awareness, creativity in critical thinking, and reflection are some of the best practices we can bring from BRC to our lives in Default. What we do, Where we do it, Who we affect with the What and Where, and Why being exercised every step of the way. All attitudes welcome and Respect will be the Dusty Rule.
Hibernaculum Camp on 6:30@E.

Friday, September 1st, 2017 8 p.m. – 11:45 p.m.

24734.name: Jacobson streching
24734.description: Jacobson is a well known streching method used in the Israeli military. When you galvanize for long hours on the playa, the one thing you need is just to stretch and relax. What better way to start your day with a sunrise strech

24735.name: Midday Cocktails at Mellow Mountain
24735.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 noon – 3 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 noon – 3 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 noon – 3 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 noon – 3 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 noon – 3 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 noon – 3 p.m.
24735.description: Join us at 8:30 & Dance for mellow libations as you take a ride on the swing or relax in the hammock dome.  Occasional karaoke as the mood hits.

24736.name: Playa Hug Team Hug Shirt Give Away!
24736.description:
Come give your best hugs and join the Playa Hug Team! We're a mobile group of huggers that roam BRC offering love, safety & connection through physical embrace!

Each year we give away 24 bright yellow Playa Hug Team sleeveless t-shirts. Along with it you get a permanent marker. When you get a shirt, put it on and go out and start giving some hugs (with permission)! When you've given 10 hugs, sign your shirt with the permanent marker and pass both your shirt and the marker to another amazing hugger. The group keeps changing, the love keeps flowing, and who knows, maybe you'll see your jersey again later on in the burn? How many names will be on it? How many hugs have been shared with it? 

"We hug to experience one another without words, to share a momentary physical connection that says, 'I love you, you’re safe, you’re good, you’re worthy.'" -Playa Hug Team Motto

24737.name: Flowga
24737.description:
Flow out of repetition...
How often when we dance do we stick with the same repetitive patterns? Perhaps we are simply bouncing to the beat. What is that saying for the pattern and repetition of our lives? How can we use movement expansion not only as this metaphor but also as a way to open neurological pathways allowing us to expand our cognition? 
Perhaps we can incorporate a greater variety of moves into our own unique dance movement flow to playfully explore what more our bodies can do and what else we can create in our reality for our lives and for the world.

24738.name: Psychedelics of Interpersonal Contact
24738.description: Explore how the person sitting next to you can be the most potent psychedelic. Learn to generate altered states through human interaction! Led by Steve Bearman, Ph.D. and Troy (TDazzl) Dayton.

24739.name: Getting Unstuck: Immediacy and Emotional Flow
24739.description:
Emotional (or motivational) flow is what happens when you're present in your immediate circumstances and connected to what you really want in this moment. It is a foundation for fulfilling, connected, and self-expressed action.  

In this experiential workshop we explore how we can use immediacy and to guide us back into a state of emotional and motivational flow. The goal here is to unhitch ourselves from three patterns that block us from flow: rehearsing thoughts, reacting from emotions, and re-referencing emotions. We'll use interactive physical exercises to explore the felt sense "stuck" that these three patterns of being create. Then we'll expand that felt understanding through a guided emotional flow meditation.

The goal of this workshop is not to offer a tool to practice emotional flow in the future, but to create an experiential understanding of how we can meet emotions to return to emotional and motivational flow.

24740.name: Rational Ritual and Pragmatic Mysticism
24740.description: Sarah McManus - Our spirituality and rationality need to be big enough to hold each other. Conflict between them can be a hindrance, or a chance for growth.

24741.name: Updates on Psychedelic Research
24741.description: George Greer, psychiatrist and the medical director of the Heffter Research Institute, gives the latest update on psychedelic research

24742.name: THE FLOWERING SOUL - RAK RAZAM
24742.description:
If EntheoGenesis is awakening to the Divine within, what do we do with IT then? Is the peak experience of divinity a seed to be integrated and/or a relationship to be nurtured? Is the current surge in interest in 5-MeO-DMT from synthetic and natural sources like the Bufo Alvarius toad just the latest stage of an entheogenic relationship flowering in human consciousness? What are the other steps in anchoring this God consciousness? Beyond the toad, can we entrain our endogenous capacity to anchor Sources, and what would this mean?  

Rak Razam

24743.name: Burning Intentions:A mindful approach to your burn
24743.description: Begin your burn with mindful intentions. Create daily affirmations for inner growth, open-hearted connections, and present-moment awareness. Our intentions will be gathered and placed in the Temple to be released into the universe through the flames of transformation.

24744.name: Keeping it Kosher
24744.description: The multitudes of rules regarding kosher food

24745.description: The Origin and Future or Life on Earth (and elsewhere)

24746.name: The Beauty of Math for Artists
24746.description:
Math - as taught in school - is tedious and boring. But mathematicians who study math create sound and impenetrable structures of logic from concepts they invented out of the blue. Like an artist creating something never seen before - it is often spectacular and beautiful.  

In this workshop I'll tell some stories about mathematical concepts directed to artists with no knowledge and try the present some of the beauty you can stumble upon when studying math. 

NO MATH SKILLS REQUIRED.

24751.name: How modern tech is reframing the travel experience
24751.description: The web, mobile, social media and various tech have made travel more accessible. Yet, this has also brought its fair share of challenges and problems: Is modern tech making it easier to book a trip, or is it more difficult to connect with other travelers? What is our responsibility, as world travelers, towards destinations, their local communities and sustainability?

24759.name: The Gloaming
24759.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 7:45 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Monday, August 28th, 2017 7:45 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 7:45 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 7:45 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 7:45 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 7:45 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 7:45 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
24759.description:
When our world is closer to the Otherworld, the spirits often traverse the thin spaces, and it is at dusk when the aes sidhe welcome the coming of the night. In a ritual that stretches back before the coming of humankind – and that also anticipates a future when humans no longer exist – the aes sidhe revel in the endless cycle of light and darkness. In a hint of what is to come, those who find themselves in the path of the sidhe court first smell and taste the dusty grit of death and rebirth. Then they hear a pounding beat that heralds the bursting of the court from the Otherworld. Bystanders soon see a dark figure with pulsing veins of red light, curling horns, and a silver face that reflects a person’s soul back at them, followed by cavorting figures who tap rhythms on a variety of drums. 

In a twisted caricature of the Pied Piper leading children astray, some of the aes sidhe beat a march for the procession, while other figures dart amongst onlookers, drawing bystanders into the procession as the group strides toward ritual stations of drums and light. The court – and its newly found attendants – pound a rhythm as the sun sinks below the horizon towards the inevitable transition, and transformation, from light to dark. The dark sidhe and its new court howl in joy as the glowing orb disappears beyond the skyline, welcoming the blessed cool of night.
 
The aes sidhe are looking for you to join our procession. Every dusk we will travel from our home at the ¡Bang! Tower to esplanade as we greet the dark in an expression of drumming, primal howling, and whatever else you can think up. The Gloaming procession will draw Black Rock City’s citizens to our 32 stations of drum and light placed around Esplanade. Join us as a spirit of the dark in a drumming celebration of sundown. 

If you want to join us, link up with our Facebook group [https://www.facebook.com/BANGtribe/], email us, or swing by the 30-foot tall ¡Bang! Tower at the Baconeers Camp at 4:15 and Dance.

24760.name: Personality Detectives- Discover the twisted you!
24760.description:
If you're a inner personality sleuth then join us as we explore the convoluted recesses of your mind, delve into the inner most shadows of the psyche and find out who you really are.  Whether we go with psycho analysis, aversion therapy or a colonoscopy, we have  everything it takes to dissect your inner most being and discover the person you really are. 
In addition to discovering your unknown, you get to make your own Rorschach Test, try on a straight jacket and take home some awesome tips on how to be a super successful Sociopath.

24763.name: Tools For Navigating Altered States
24763.description: Upgrade your psychonaut tool kit and empower your inner shaman!  Psychotherapist and Medicine Retreats organizer Meriana Dinkova will introduce some important factors to consider when navigating altered states of consciousness. You will learn some useful tools that can maximize our experience, as well as what we can learn in those inner voyages. Non- ordinary states of consciousness can come with their own sets of 'superpowers', operating principles and potential pitfalls. Knowing how to use those forces for expansion and alignment can not only occasionally save you from 'the inner gates of hell', but also bring accelerated growth, ecstatic experiences and a deep feeling of connectedness with yourself, others and the world.

24774.description: with Daniel Pinchbeck - Most people don't think of psychedelic futurism as a reasonable career path.  They miss enthralling opportunities to explore esoteric, post-human, and apocalyptic concepts for a wide audience. In this talk and workshop, we will explore the future of psychedelic futurism as the Singularity nears and the weirdness deepens.

24775.name: NALOXONE TRAINING
24775.description: Naloxone Training with Annie Oak to Prevent Opioid Overdose

24776.name: Rick Doblin PhD of M.A.P.S.
24776.description:
FDA-Approved Phase 3 MDMA/PTSD Research: A $25 million experiment 

Description:  MAPS' 31 year struggle to begin Phase 3 research into MDMA-assisted psychotherapy for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and will review the agreement reached with FDA in July 2017 on the methodological design of our Phase 3 studies.  I'll discuss the implementation of Phase 3 and the timeline  and steps required to legalize the prescription use of MDMA-assisted psychotherapy, the establishment of psychedelic psychotherapy clinics, and the overall mainstreaming of the legal use of psychedelics into global culture.

24777.name: John Gilmore of Electronic Frontier Foundation
24777.description: Q & A with John Gilmore, co-founder of Electronic Frontier Foundation

24778.name: THE BIG FOOD SMACKDOWN & KETO HAPPY HOUR
24778.description:
All you need to know about Roundup, Glyhphosate & more by Medical biohacker Toni Bark MD, followed by Happy Hour serving delcious low carb Keto-Ritas.

We'll delve into Big Food, Terrible Oils (Canola & Soy), phthalates, BPA, titanium leeching and more.  You'l learn how to take control of your food supply and your health!

Then you can enjoy some  delcious low carb Keto-Ritas made with organic lime juice.

24779.name: John Halcyon Styn
24779.description: Experiences in the Burning Man Culture and Communities

24780.name: Psychology of Completeness / DA Breathing

24782.name: Psychedelics in Healing and Your Relationships
24782.description: Warren McKee - Psychedelics in Healing and Your Relationships

24783.name: The Struggle for the Sacred
24783.description:
Cultural appropriation is a topic that brings heated debate nearly every time it’s mentioned. Quite often, ignorant westerners who were raised to purchase meaning on a shelf or through a TV set can trigger sensitivities within traditional or sacred cultures, while at the same time individuals that seek in earnest to experience authentic meaning by transcending that very same commercial culture are easily stereotyped as insensitive or as frauds. The word “shamanism,” for example, is taken for granted and thrown around casually in festival culture, and yet who can agree on what it truly means in our context or who it legitimately offends?

We’ll uncover the complex history of this term while exploring a vision for planetary culture that integrates the profane and materialistic west with the sacred magic of the indigenous and the archaic. The story of the west is surprisingly rich with culture heroes (including the Cacophony Society and Suicide Club groups that Burning Man emerged from) that point the way towards a rich and meaningful cultural future, despite the overwhelming totality of capitalism. In fact, in the development of a global psychedelic culture, the world market has actually paved the way for a diverse confluence of neo-tribal adaptation and integration much the same way as the Romans built the roads that ultimately spread Christianity. Authentic cultural appropriation is the way forward and superficial cultural appropriation is a natural evolutionary byproduct.

24792.description:
"Are you going to see Daft Punk at the trash fence?"

It started as a joke that longtime Burners would play on virgins or weekend warriors. This is no laughing matter as Daft Punk has not played since 2007. Join us in setting the stage as we attempt to get them out of retirement. If they do not show then someone else will throw on some Daft Punk helmets and do the best Daft Punk show since 2007. We will have drinks on site, shuttles to the bathroom, and dozens of art cars linked up and ready to make this a night that we will never forget. 
Schedule

Location: 12 and Trash Fence 
(Ride straight back from the Temple until you hit the trash fence)

24793.name: Celebrate your 20+ years of burn with us!
24793.description: Celebrating 20+ year of Burning Man with you! Howdy fellow burners! I'm Whee-zel, and as a founding member of (Camp) Yes Please, I am honored to have playa-mates celebrating my 20 Year Anniversary of attending Burning Man. Of course, there’s no “status” in how many times a person attends this amazing experience, but it sure is a great reason to party with y’all, and why keep all this fun to ourselves? So if you are a 20+ year Burner (or know someone who is), you’re invited (and your friends, really… who’s gonna keep track?) to be honored and celebrated at Yes Please. Please come by, have a drink, tell a story or two and be acknowledged for your amazing Burn-ification however many years you’ve attended! Yes Please!

24794.name: Black Rock Charades Champion
24794.description:
For the 3d time in a row we are organizing an awesome charades competition under our huge comfy shade structure on Esplanade. 

Come play with increasing levels of difficulty and have a chance to win delicious pots of Ice Cream on the playa ! Lots of fun for everyone !

Thursday 3PM @ 8:45 & Esplanade

Did you forget your shampoo, deodorant and other hygiene products at home and you’re now stuck with the natural scent of ‘Get out of my tent, you smell’? Have you just crossed the sun-beaten playa, leaving you with the desperate need to refuel with a light snack or carbonated drink?

Well you’re in luck! The playa does provide with a can do, fuck you attitude. Stop by Circle J™ for an irresponsible selection of products designed to make you feel like you’re back in corporate America. With our one franchised location inconveniently located not near you, we’re waiting to serve you with a frown that will turn your day upside down.

Sorry, we’re open!

24796.name: Cheesy Cocktail Lounge Party
24796.description:
Formal wear, cocktails, Richard Cheese lounge covers of modern songs, and of course, cheese. 

Don't have formal wear? Not to worry dear guest! Our maître d' would be happy to loan you a dinner jacket for the evening.

The lounge is located on the 2nd and 3rd floors of the Firehouse in Do-More-Now Village, 7:30 & C.

24798.description: Barbie Day Spa provides a 24/7, self-serve fingernail painting station at 3:50 and Eulogy.  Stop by and paint your nails or make a friend and paint each other's nails.

24799.name: Midnight Ridazz: Friday Night Ride
24799.description:
When someone says "Midnight Ridazz!!" 
You say "RIDE ON!!"

The Midnight Ridazz is formally described as a group of bicycle enthusiasts who have been riding together on the second Friday of every month since February of 2004. Originally conceived and founded by SKULL and lovingly cared for by MABELL, MUFF and a small group of planners and care takers, the rides quickly grew from the original 8 "Mammas and Papas" to current ride counts of 1300+ Ridazz.

Skeptics may scoff at the irreverence of this alleged "Party on Wheels." But the party atmosphere just might be what has made this simple bicycle ride so popular in a city like Los Angeles where people barely get their mail without hopping in a car. Some attribute the movement to the high assed gas prices, or the frustration of LA traffic. Still others simply write off the Midnight Ridazz as a bunch of bored art school students. It's all of these things and more! 

Consider: Riding a bicycle is a sensual alternative to the "boy in the bubble" car voyages that hide everything good that a city has to offer. It is an experience in sights, sounds, thrills, physical activity, and local economy that could never be replicated by a night out at (Sh)City Walk. Midnight Ridazz is about riding bicyles, hanging out, acting silly, being whimsical, speaking up, and having a good heart. Come out and enjoy a relaxed pace bicycle ride at the end of a week of computers, dispatchers, rude customers, corporate politics and all the other crap that comes with living in a world of sad clowns. Banish the clowns! Send in the Ridazz.


JOIN US.
Moving forward we're inviting everybody to join in the fun. The Ridazz that be have created this site to help empower YOU to create your own rides, routes and good timezz. Start yourself a recurring ride, have a bar crawl or even throw a one timer in the daylight... It's your ride.

24800.name: Cold Brew Coffee!
24800.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 10 a.m. – noon
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 10 a.m. – noon

Thursday, August 31st, 2017 10 a.m. – noon
Friday, September 1st, 2017 10 a.m. – noon

Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 10 a.m. – noon
24800.description: Tasty cold-brew coffee served up every morning until we run out!  Get your caffeine fix and get energized for the new day!

24801.name: Ridazz: No Plans On Thursday
24801.description: No plans on Thursday. None. (No plans allowed for Thursday). Not allowed to make plans for Thursday. Is this considered a plan? All-day non-event.

24803.name: Ridazz Camp: Saturday Morning Car-less-tunes
24803.description:
Bicycle & Bullhorn Workshop for Kids! Learn to fix your own bike, and proper use of the megaphone! Virgin versions of our drinks will be available! 

The Kid version of our Fix Your Own **** Bike! Music from your favorite cartoons. Learn to fix a flat! Play with megaphones, and make your own! 

Virgin version of our Blood, Sweat, Tears & Vomit for the kids. (Harder versions available for their hard working adults.)

24804.name: Bootie Shorts Making
24804.description: Feel the smooth perfect fit of spandex against your tush at our Bootie Shorts Making Workshop! We will help you make a pair of your very own! Expert Booty assessors and seamstresses will help you to step into the tiny shorts that your booty has been dreaming of. You are going to want to wear them every darn day! Materials provided. Get your booty over here!!

24805.name: Make Your Own Harness
24805.description: Whoa there! Giddy up over to the Kostume Kult crafting dome and make your very own harness! Materials and instruction will be provided you just bring a sexy bod to harness up!

24806.name: Kostume Kult Costume Station & Runway Show
24806.description: GRAND OPENING DAY! Are you under costumed? Kostume Kult can help you radically self express yourself and look your burner best! Get a free costume transformation at our Kostume Station. Find the costume that speaks to you, put it on and walk the runway to show of your new fashion statement. Burners of any age and size are welcome. We have tons costumes from all around the world that you are going to love. The costumes are for you to keep forever and remember us fondly.

24807.name: Kostume Station & Runway Show
24807.description: We want to gift you a costume! Kostume Kult collects new and gently used costumes to give to you, YES YOU! Receive a FREE costume transformation at our Kostume Station. Find the costume that speaks to you, put it on and walk the runway to show of your new fashion statement. Burners of any age and size are welcome. We have tons costumes from all around the world that you are going to love. These costumes will get your into the trouble you have been looking for!

24808.name: REVERSING CANCER ON KETO & KETO HAPPY HOUR
24808.description: Medical Bio hacker Dr Toni Bark will explain how a keto diet has improved the health of cancer patients in her care. You'll learn how cancer cells are fueled (glucose) and what you can do to inhibit their growth, and how your keto diet plays a part. After, hang out and enjoy some killer Keto-ritas.

24809.name: Mojito Monday - 10th Minty Years
24809.description:
Mojito Monday returns to Black Rock City for it's TENTH year! 

Stop by for the best damn mojitos on the playa, mixed and served by Mojito Molly herself. Starts at 2, continues until we run out of ingredients or Molly passes out. 

Come by and start the burn off right, and help MoMo celebrate a decade of getting you day drunk! Bring a cup.

24810.name: Virgin Burn: Moms & Dads Meet & Greet!
24810.description: Hola! Any virgin mom n dads this year? Meet n greet on tha lovely dusty playa tuesday @ noon at center camp cafe!

24811.name: Electronic Music by Camp Soft Landing DJ's
24811.description: Electronic Music by Camp Soft Landing DJ's

24812.name: Cyberacoustic Guitar by Michael Garfield
24812.description: Come listen to the music used in recent FDA-approved clinical trials for MDMA as a treatment for post-traumatic stress...Michael has spent the last decade touring festivals across the US, Europe, and Australia with his unique approach to both acoustic-electronic live performance.  Tender and apocalyptic, chill and energetic, intensely technical yet vulnerable music that updates the archetype of "solo artist with guitar" to suit our age of planetary renaissance.  Ecstatic instrumentals pointing past the genre into transcendental spaces – lush and atmospheric, driving and emotional work, spanning folk tradition and the avant-garde.

24813.name: Samuel J & Friends Colorful Music Concert
24813.description: Join Samuel J for this unmissable concert. His collaborative and unifying style will bring together several talented musicians for some hard-hitting performances. Samuel uses a loop pedal to craft a full band sound, recording multiple instruments and vocal parts live. His incredible love and respect for all people and importance of nature shine through his music.

24814.name: Going Deep with Samuel J
24814.description: Join this unmissable night, as we go deep into healing through powerful heartfelt acoustic music. This performance will be similar to some of the performances he has conducted in temples and sacred spaces around the world, including with his Holiness the Dalai Lama and with Ida the Water Priestess of Bali Indonesia. Come share this amazing light vibration.

24815.name: Shamanic Visioneering: Crafting Your Life Mission
24815.description: A guided dream discerning your Manifesto for the World. Why is civilization so often out of touch with our intentions, needs and values? How do we find and create the tribe and society we want and need? This workshop dives into these questions by dreaming into our relationship to each other and the world. Within the world of shadows and the infinite, we will open to where our spirit calls us and discover our mission as well as opportunities to create harmony in our Tribes and the World.

24816.name: Go Crazy for Swayze!
24816.description: Get Crazy for Swayze: You'll have the time of your life and you'll owe it all to us. Help us build Black Rock City's largest Patrick Swayze repository: oral history, artifacts, and Swayze Spirit offerings. Destiny readings, face painting, family trauma tangling & untangling, and dirty dancing. Come by to play Swayze bean bag toss and we'll assign you your very own playa adventure. We have mullets!

24817.name: The Lighting of Barry the Disco Goat
24817.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Monday, August 28th, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Monday, September 4th, 2017 7 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
24817.description: Every evening, when we get around, Barry the Disco Goat will be lit at the 4:30 plaza.  Disco Dance Party to accompany the lighting. Come Dance!  Barry the Disco Goat brings joy to everyone and he is most pleased when people are dancing.

24818.name: PonchoPartuza
24818.description: We are a Village of 60+ noisy (mostly) argentinians that have participated in several Gerlach Burns, and hosted the regional event in Buenos Aires [Fuego Austral] two times in a row. Come to party and share music, mate and experience from our region. BYOponcho or get one when you get in. FCFS

24819.name: Meet the Artists Tour Broadcast on BMIR 94.5 FM
24819.description: Coming at you directly from the Playa on BMIR - Burning Man Information Radio! An "unholy" alliance between the ARTery and BMIR, the Meet the Artist Broadcast will be hosted by Diablo, Dazzle! & G-Spot. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~There is a ton of AMAZING Art this year and we're gonna tell you about SOME of it, while interviewing a FEW of the incredible artists who dreamed it all up and created these fantastic works. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You can turn in to BMIR 94.5 FM while on the Playa, stream on-line worldwide at http://www.BMIR.org/ or (best of all) come follow the tour on your bike! Which Art Car to follow? None other than The Queen of BRC: "Christina" and Captain Flipper. Just look on the Esplanade near the ARTery/BMIR for a gorgeous 58' yacht with blue "waves" on her hull. http://bit.ly/ChristinaArtCar ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Have you ever stopped and wondered about some of the art out on the playa, and thought: "What the Fuck were they thinking!?!" Now you might just find out . . . All YOU have to do now on Thursday September 1st, 2016 just before 11:00 a.m. is remember to: TURN ON! ~Your radio TUNE IN! ~To 94.5 FM on the Playa (or stream on-line @ http://www.BMIR.org/) or DROP EVERYTHING ~You Dusty Burner & come follow us out into the desert on your bicycle . . . Thanks! Diablo

24820.name: Dead Hand Magician Meet and Greet
24820.description: Walking the path? Curious? Skeptical but friendly? Come hang out with us and talk sacrificial turkey.

24821.name: Sigil Workshop
24821.description: Learn how to create sigils to challenge the will of consensus reality using Austin Spare's technique.

Thursday, August 31st, 2017 1 p.m. – 6 p.m.
