24822.description: One on one tarot readings from trained diviners.

24825.name: Slut Garden Take Over!
24825.description: We are having a Nipple Riot Party and of course the neighborhood Sluts found out. When Slut Garden takes over your bar, you know It's Fucking Magic!

24826.name: Heather and Baxter become Haxter!
24826.description:
Come celebrate the union of Heather and Baxter at Sunset at Sunset!

These two are getting hitched, we all know the story! #freebaxter

2016

"Hey you two going get married?"

"Naw....."

2017 - #freebaxter

"Hey, we're getting married.

24827.name: Hip Hop Playa Don't Stop
24827.description: Get your boogie on and learn some slick dance moves! Luke will be teaching a fun beginners dance combo with some moves you can take to your local dance floor

24828.name: MegaHoop
24828.description: Come decorate your own custom hula hoop, practice and share your favorite hooping tricks, and have a funky good time playing with an enormous MegaHoop.

24829.name: Where is my mind?
24829.description: Drift away and explore a deeper truth with Alan Watts

24830.name: Furque du Soleil
24830.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
24830.description: Linzer Liger taught at Circus Boot Camp, and now he’s here to teach you mad juggling skills!

24831.name: Trailer Trash Tuesday - Tippy Cup Tournament
24831.description:
Come join us for this Tippy Cup Tournament, those with trash bag tutus (remember Tutu Tuesday?) go to the front of the line.  Can you beat last year's returning champ? Souvenir Playa cups & Lanyards while supplies last.
Flip cup (canoe, taps, flippy cup or tippy cup) is a team-based drinking game.[1]

24832.name: Protect your Photography Equipment from the dust
24832.description:
Protect your equipment from the dust.  Come learn how to correctly create a camera condom or come learn what magical solution cleans this dust off of anything,  -  we have the supplies and expertise.  Come ask questions, clean and tape up your camera, or just share your knowledge with others.

Instructor: Grant Wigmore - burner since the early 1990’s – fix it guy extraordinaire

24833.name: Sacred Form Photography
24833.description:
Sacred Form Photography - creating artistic nude images on the playa, In this workshop we will give participants the opportunity to create artistic nude photography.  Through out history artists have created art around the shape of the human body.  This workshop will teach you how to do that with photography.

Instructor: Kyer Wiltshire – Kyer is a professional photographer from Santa Cruz, CA.  Kyer  is a destination photographer traveling the world to shoot weddings and events.  Kyer has published two books on Burning Man. (http://kyerwiltshire.com/)

24834.name: Basic Camera Settings - Take better pics OFF auto
24834.description:
Basic Camera Settings - F stop does not mean F__k stop.   This class will teach you how to take your camera off of “Auto” and use the full range of settings on today’s digital cameras.

Instructor: Chris Oggerino – Chris is a semi-pro (working on being pro) sports photographer and videographer in Reno, NV.  He has been a documentarian at Burning Man and has created images for magazines, a museum, and web sites over the last 10 years.

24835.name: Photographing Fire Dancers
24835.description:
A hands on participatory workshop that will focus on capturing fire trails and the fire artist using a strobe.

Instructor: Kevin LeVezu – Kevin is a professional photographer from Denver, CO.  He specializes in portrait, product and event photography.  He has been a documentarian for burning man for 4 years and has been a displaying artist as well.  (www.kevinsphoto.com)

24836.name: Field Trip - Natural and Ambient Light Photography
24836.description:
Field Trip!! Get your ass out of bed and shoot the playa! we will be focusing on the use of natural and ambient light to shoot pics of people while using shadows and other inanimate objects to add to the scene. 
Instructor: Siddharth Srinivasan Iyengar  - Sid is a wedding and portrait photographer originally from ___, India and now living in New York. (www.sidsyart.com)

24837.name: Shooting Video that Sucks Less
24837.description:
The basics of good video form from a cellphone to a DSLR. 

Instructor: Jeremy Dunn – Jeremy is a videographer and producer and the owner of Spotfire.  He has extensive experience in television and movie production and has created burning man documentaries for PBS and for private distribution.  His most recent film:
Burning Man: Set The World On Fire (www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4uxzj48zCw)

24838.name: Shooting Video While Intoxicated (Home Made Beer!)
24838.description:
The basics of good video form from a cellphone to a DSLR but we will be serving home made beer. 
Instructor: Jeremy Dunn – Jeremy is a videographer and producer and the owner of Spotfire.  He has extensive experience in television and movie production and has created burning man documentaries for PBS and for private distribution.  His most recent film:
Burning Man: Set The World On Fire (www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4uxzj48zCw)
Jeremy Dunn also makes home brew so he is going to share it while he teaches the class for a second time.

24839.name: Photographing Fire Performers, flame as light
24839.description:
“Photographing Fire Performers using the flame as your light” –  Most performers are one with the flame that they dance with.  Come learn how to capture that in a hands-on workshop by one of the best fire photogs out there!

Instructor:  Espresso Buzz I've been photographing events and playing with cameras since I "borrowed" my first camera from my parents when I went to college. My photos have been featured in national & international publications and have been in a few galleries.  I've been photographing the art, people and performances of burning man since the year 2000.   You can find me on Instagram as Espressobuzz, and also at http://www.espressobuzz.net/browse.
I hope to see you on playa!

24840.name: Photographing Fire Breathers

24841.name: Deeply Hungover Deep Fried Goodness
24841.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 2 p.m. – 3 p.m.
24841.description: Let us make you something to help with that hangover. French fries, hand cut, twice fried in peanut oil.... or maybe something else entirely. Basically we have a deep fryer and we know how to use it. We told the chef what to cook, but she never listens.   We are Cafe Surprise after all. Come by early on Friday (noonish) for our big finale!

24842.name: Re-Weaving the Human Dream w/LeeAnn @ RhythmWave
24842.description: Dancing Freedom is an ecstatic, shamanic, somatic and expressive movement practice – a radical and grounded movement ritual. Our prayer for tonight’s ceremony: please help us truly walk on this earth in a good way. The invitation: start with yourself and your own sacred body. We will engage the energies of earth, water, fire, air, and ether to open new possibilities for ourselves and for the world. All are welcome to join LeeAnn Mallorie at RhythmWave for body activation, personal awakening and transpersonal healing from this 5-element dance wave. The only rule in Dancing Freedom? There’s no way to do it wrong.

24843.name: It Was On Fire When I Got Here
24843.description: A talk about the preparing for and implementing a fire safety systems in Black Rock City. With some juicy stories.

24844.name: It's Never Too Late to Have a Happy Childhood
24844.description: Rough childhoods are not uncommon, and the effects alter lives and communities. Learn how our earliest challenges shape our behavior, health, cultures, and communities. Discover the transformative power of art in healing the effects of adverse childhood experiences.

24845.name: The Framing Effect of Costumes
24845.description: Costumes serve as frames for radical self-expression. The Empress will share historical and personal perspectives of how costumes allow characters to emerge and communicate effectively with others.

24847.name: Photography Basics
24847.description: Come learn some basic photography tips to help you capture that perfect playa moment!

24848.name: Our Driverless Future
24848.description: Our driverless future? A U.S. historian discusses how self-driving cars may change planning, labor, consumption, design, sex, everyday life

24849.name: Inner Bee
24849.description: Raves, rituals, protests, and war - how to activate your inner bee!

24850.name: Permaculture & Development Projects
24850.description: Interested in Permaculture?  Stop by and learn about a development project, located in Colombia, that put the principles in action.

24851.name: Beer Yoga
24851.description: The energising benefits of Yoga and Beer drinking have been known in many parts of the world for centuries.  Here and now new secrets of their combined power will be revealed!!!!!!

24852.name: Meteorite or Meteo-wrong?
24852.description: Can you tell the difference between your average rock and a Meteorite? Meteorite enthusiast ready to share his knowledge and his collection. Stop By and check out his rocks!

24853.name: Kostume Station & Runway Show
24853.description: Come receive a FREE costume transformation at our Kostume Station. Find the costume that speaks to you, put it on and walk the runway to show of your new fashion statement. Burners of any age and size are welcome. We have tons costumes and one will pick you to be their owner! Upgrade your look and your life or your money back!

24854.name: Kostume Station & Runway Show
24854.description: Receive a free costume transformation at Kostume Kult. Find the costume that picks YOU, put it on and walk the runway! Burners of any age and size are welcome. Come upgrade your already fabulous look! The runway will sizzle with style with MCs on hand to talk you up to the audience. It's the greatest show on playa!

24855.name: Kostume Station & Runway Show
24855.description: You better werk! Down our runway that is. Come to Kostume Kult to receive a free costume transformation and emerge from our costume station a new burner! We have costumes in all sizes for all burners. Open your mind and let a costume pick YOU! Then sashay and chantay down our runway as our MCs lavish you with praise on your new look! This free costume will change your burn! If you have experienced a costume malfunction we also have repair tools at the crafting dome.

24856.name: Finding Our Light - Metaphysics and Personal Truth
24856.description: Our incredible world is not as separate from us as we think. How can we understand metaphysics and listen to our physical frames to understand consciousness, make meaningful decisions, and cast off the frames others try to place around us?

24857.name: Meditation Man
24857.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 10 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 10 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.
24857.description: As the morning rolls around, come join Wolfie and sit down.  The Genie Bottle is the place for the mindfulness meditation, where you can set a Burning Man intention during this community self-ascension!

24858.name: The neuroscience of HUGS - Magda Jary
24858.description:
Experience and learn how hugs impact and change your brain! In this light and interactive workshop you will hear about research showing multiple ways that proper deep hugs, where the hearts are pressing together, can benefit you. Come prepared to nourish your mind and body!

Monday, 4 -5  pm PST
Friday, 2 -3 pm PST

24859.name: The neuroscience of HUGS - Magda Jary
24859.description: Experience and learn how hugs impact and change your brain! In this light and interactive workshop you will hear about research showing multiple ways that proper deep hugs, where the hearts are pressing together, can benefit you. Come prepared to nourish your mind and body!

24860.name: Free your voice - Justyna Jary
24860.description: "Free Your Voice" is a vocal workshop run by Justyna Jary (Polish actress and singer). It involves an intense work on breathing, discovering the variety of colors of sound and singing through the body as well as singing mono and polyphonic traditional songs. Free Your Voice and let it hug others around you with warmth and melody you might have not experienced before!

24861.name: Ten Principals Workshop
24861.description: Still unclear on the 10 principals? Join our camp in learning what the 10 principles mean to us. Our veterans will share practical playa experiences and Q&A relating to each principle in a group discussion.

24862.name: Flow Yoga
24862.description: Enjoy the pleasures of restorative partner yoga with guided meditation. Yoga mats provided.

24863.name: Authentic Movement Workshop
24863.description: Use group movement exercises as a way of getting in your body, freeing the inner dialogue and working with someone to identify what the emotional attachment is to what you're doing.

24864.name: 3rd Annual Garden Soiree
24864.description: This is our most promoted outreach, an event to introduce our playa neighbors to our Garden. Meet our camp, taste our jungle potion, dance and energize your body before your evening adventures!

24865.name: Champagne 101
24865.description: Our aspiring sommelier will educate you on the magic of the bubbly. Share a toast with your fellow gardeners.

24866.name: Illustrated Organism
24866.description: Our resident art teacher will guide you in creating an original drawing of a garden flower. Supplies provided.

24867.name: Essential Oil Workshop
24867.description: If you're curious about essential oils, introduce yourself to the basics of essential oils in our relaxing garden space.

24868.name: Sunrise Sessions
24868.description: A low tempo musical exploration of joyful salutations honoring sunshine and spirit animals.

24869.name: Flow Yoga
24869.description: Travelers will be guided in a 1 hour yoga class for restoring the mind and body. Suitable for all levels.

24870.name: Monday Pickle Service
24870.description: Enjoy a cold pickle on a hot dusty day.  We invite passersby to step under our shade and enjoy a refreshing treat, a seat, and engaging conversation

24871.name: Tuesday Pickle Service
24871.description: Enjoy a cold pickle on a hot dusty day.  We invite passersby to step under our shade and enjoy a refreshing treat, a seat, and engaging conversation

24872.name: Thursday Pickle Service
24872.description: Enjoy a cold pickle on a hot dusty day.  We invite passersby to step under our shade and enjoy a refreshing treat, a seat, and engaging conversation

24873.name: Computational Rumination: Machine w/"Common Sense"
24873.description: What happens when you probe the mind of a primitive artificial intelligence with common sense reasoning capabilities?

24874.name: Royal Game of Ur
24874.description: Learn to play the Royal Game of Ur, a board game more than 4500 years old! It was played across the world in ancient times, including in Egypt, Mesopotamia and Babylonia. Historians believe it may be the inspiration for modern games like backgammon. The game itself is a competitive game played with two players. Though the game relies on special dice, you will need more than simple luck to win the Royal Game of Ur!

24876.name: Clarity & Consent Playshop provided by BED
24876.description:
The Bureau of Erotic Discourse (BED) is helping to make consent the 11th principle!  You'll learn fun, interactive information about sex on playa,  negotiating consent, how to get what we desire in bed and other fun,  adult topics. 
We'll discuss need to know knowledge gathered through years of experience in BED  :
*Recognizing potentially bad situations  
*Resolving them with tact and humor  
*Supporting survivors of assault  
*Helping them access available services

24877.name: Dance Therapy Workshop
24877.description:
What's Dance/Movement Therapy?! Come and find out! In these workshops, we will work toward integrating our bodies, minds and psyches by connecting to ourselves and others around us through movement. No dance experience necessary, just a willingness to move. 

There will be two 45 minute workshops over the 2 hours. 
Capacity for approximately 20 participants/workshop

24878.name: Slow waltzing and mimosas
24878.description: Slow waltzing to live music or recordings.   Mellow and appropriate for the heat of the day.  No experience necessary nor do you need to arrive with a partner.  Arrive early for some simple instruction.  At our slow pace the footwork doesn't have to click for you for the dancing to be pleasant (and awkwardness is just one of life's phases anyway).  It is worth practicing until that day when it does click and then you have a talent which can be used anywhere in the world, and is especially appreciated by romantic partners.

24879.name: Square/barn dancing to live music
24879.description: Square and barn dancing to live music (traditional/ oldtime /bluegrass /American).   Fast-paced and exciting yet easy to learn.  No experience necessary nor do you need to arrive with a partner.  A caller walks the dancers through each dance before the music starts (with the dances lasting about 15 minutes).  Each dance is a (different) repeating sequence of relatively simple moves.  Hooting and stomping and a tribal vibe, where the Zen is playfulness, flow, synchrony, and bonding (not footwork, not competition).  If you are smiling, you are doing it right.  Kid friendly.  Possible for many disabled.   Everyone who shows up should have a good time.  Videos at the website.  You can  square dance all over the US  (and a smattering of other countries) in dance halls with up to a thousand people.  But the Playa makes it special so you should try it with us first!

24880.name: contradancing to live music (beginners welcome)
24880.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 8 p.m. – 11 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 8 p.m. – 11 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 8 p.m. – 11 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 8 p.m. – 11 p.m.
24880.description: Experience the tribal, hypnotic magic of contra, driven by everything from traditional celtic, to exotic electronic mixing of recordings and live instruments.  Contra is fast-paced and exciting, yet easy to learn. A "caller" instructs, but there is room for dancers to improvise and embellish. There is no need to arrive with a partner – most dancers swap after each dance. Lines of couples flow through each other creating a bonding, playful, noncompetitive, all-ages community dance. There is no required footwork and contra is possible for many with disabilities. If you are smiling, you are doing it right. Everyone who shows up will have fun, and will probably find they can't stop from joining in on the hooting and stomping.   Videos at the website.  You can contradance all over the US  (and a smattering of other countries) in dance halls with up to a thousand people.  But the Playa makes it special so you should try it with us first!

24881.name: Tutu Tuesday Survival Party
24881.description:
Congratulations! You survived Tutu Tuesday. Drag yourself into Camp Pendant, the Best Little Camp On The Playa™, for a refreshing facial, gazpacholadas, and Tracy's Famous Greyhounds. 

PLEASE NOTE: This is an oontz-free zone.

24883.name: Feel good Pilates with Angela Strachan
24883.time:
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 10 a.m. – 11 a.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 noon – 1 p.m.
24883.description: Join me for some feel good Pilates exercises and get in tune with your body. Bring your mat if you have one or towel.

24884.name: GLAMCOCKS: QueerTalks & Workshops
24884.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 1 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 1 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 1 p.m. – 3 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 1 p.m. – 3 p.m.
24884.description:
Are you ready to challenge your worldview, step outside your comfort zone, and provide a little TLC for your body and brain at Burning Man? Join the GlamCocks and friends for QueerTalks and Workshops: a series of moderated audience discussions and wellness activities on topics important to our queer communities. Join in on a real-talk discussion or push your body and mind with yoga, meditation, and vulnerability. Our thought provoking discussions may not always be comfortable, but are intended to be a safe space where we can learn and grow together.

QueerTalks and Workshops schedule:

MONDAY

1:00 - 2:00 pm, Deepen Your Burn with Mindfulness and Vulnerability
Facilitated by Pretzel (Michael Donofrio, GlamCocks)
Located in GlamCocks' Morecockin Tent (7:30 & D)

2:00 - 3:00 pm, Walk Out With Your Cock Out
Facilitated by Thunder (Chris Turner, GlamCocks) 
Meet outside GlamCocks' Morecockin Tent (7:30 & D) and walk to the temple

TUESDAY

1:00 - 2:00 pm, Radical Consent 
Facilitated by Nexus (I AM U)
Located in GlamCocks' Morecockin’ Tent (7:30 & D)

2:00 - 3:00 pm, Let’s Talk About Sex: Barebacking in the Age of PrEP and Undetectable 
Facilitated by Treat (Christopher Ruiz) & Michael Marcel (GlamCocks). 
Located in GlamCocks' Morecockin Tent (7:30 & D)

WEDNESDAY

1:00 - 2:00 pm, Radical Gender F*ckery, A Journey Outside the Binary 
Facilitated by Ronnie Appleseed (Gender Blender)
Located in GlamCocks' Morecockin Tent (7:30 & D)

2:00 - 3:00 pm, Masterfully Navigating the Pitfalls of Polyamory 
Facilitated by Stallion (Kamela, Camp Beaverton/ATTOL)
Located in GlamCocks' Morecockin Tent (7:30 & D)

THURSDAY

1:00 - 2:00 pm, Radical Spirit Yoga 
Facilitated by National Treasure (Paradise Motel)
Located in GlamCocks' Morecockin Tent (7:30 & D)

2:00 - 3:00 pm, Tantric Breathing Meditation 
Facilitated by Joshua Farahnik (GlamCocks)
Located in GlamCocks' Morecockin Tent (7:30 & D)

24885.name: CAMP JUICY! B&4:45 Afternoon smoothies and beats
24885.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 noon – 4 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 noon – 4 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 noon – 4 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 noon – 4 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 noon – 4 p.m.
24885.description:
FRUIT! ICE! MIX! DJs!
Mon - Fri NOON -4
This year we have rented a refrigerator truck 
For frozen fruit and a place to chill..

24886.name: Elephant Merry-go-round
24886.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Monday, August 28th, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Monday, September 4th, 2017 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
24886.description: Join our "I Love Elephants" crew and mount our carousel! Our life sized elephants are elevated on a high merry go round. You've never seen such a thing and neither have we....that's why we built it! Somebody had too!

24887.name: Paint Your Love of Elephants
24887.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Monday, August 28th, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Monday, September 4th, 2017 9 a.m. – 7:30 p.m.
24887.description: We love elephants, so much so that our local artist cooperative created a huge and beautiful mural of Asian Elephants and their habitat. We're displaying it beneath our elephant merry-go-round. We want you to be inspired to do your own artwork upon part of our 200 square feet of blank white canvas. While you're here - ride the merry go round, be misted by the best misting system on the Playa (it really is! many years in the making). Also, have a cold beer or coconut water in one of our community shade structures and let's talk about elephants!

24888.name: Accountants / Camp Treasurers Meetup
24888.description: Have you ever wondered what other accounting nerds are on playa?  Drop by and find out. Have a slushy something and count some beans.

24889.name: Burning Lady Happy Hour
24889.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 2 p.m. – 4 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 2 p.m. – 4 p.m.
24889.description: It’s Ladies night! Ladies drink free! And so does everyone else (of age!)! Try our Burning Lady cocktail-- sip on spicy spirits, and we’ll spice up your spirit!

24890.name: Bitches and Hoedowns
24890.description: Stop horsing around: saddle up your bike and head over for some ranch revelry! Sip on udderly delicious moo-garitas, groove to moo-sic from Cosmic Ranch DJs… and maybe even lasso a sparkle pony!

24891.name: Twerkshop
24891.description: Earn your Masters in Social Twerk! Show your twerk ethic as you learn various twerk variations, including the Twerk-life balance, the Circle Twerk, and of course the wheel barrow handstand jello shot twerk! Event will culminate with a Twerk-off--and TROPHIES!

24892.name: Pillowcase Impromptu Bondage Workshop
24892.description: Need to tie up your lover but left the ropes at home? Use something you probably already have in your tent! Grab your pillowcase and learn how to leave your partner paralyzed with pleasure in a pinch!

24893.name: Galactic Get Down: a bacchanALIEN Bash
24893.description: The martian mothership has landed, and we want U(fo) to join us sextraterrestials for some out of this world beats and cosmic cocktails.

24894.name: Zen Sit
24894.time:
Sunday, August 27th, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
Monday, August 28th, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017 7 a.m. – 7:45 a.m.
24894.description: No frills silent zen sitting practice. Guidance for first few minutes, silent concentration practice otherwise. Bring your cush if you have one. Sit, breathe, release, repeat.

24895.name: YogiTantric Connection
24895.description: Open your energetic body and dive into your deep tantric state through yoga and partnered (non-sexual) tantric exercises. Discover an authentic and heart-opening bliss within.

24896.name: 5 Rhythms Liberation
24896.description: Come and dance with us on a movement meditation over the playa, healing your insides with a wave of soul sounds.

24897.name: 5 Rhythms Meditation
24897.description: Listen, feel and move. Open the canals of your body and let the healing power of sound talk through you. (If you have a yoga mat, please bring it with you.)

24898.name: Sound Meditation with Alexandre Tannous
24898.description: The experience starts by sharing important elements about sound and its therapeutic effects. This would allow to maximize the benefits by becoming active participants, and to learn how to efficiently work with sound. The material shared is based on years of training in music, fieldwork in many countries, research and scientific studies. Following the talk, Alexandre will guide everyone through diaphragmatic breathing exercises, visualizations, toning and vocalizations. The longest segment will follow; playing of instruments that emit harmonic overtones, such as gongs of various diameters, antique Himalayan singing bowls, tuning forks with varying frequencies, etc.

24899.name: Women's Sound Circle with Casey Karr
24899.description:
Gathering intentionally with other women offers an opportunity to give and receive our feminine nourishment, where we support, empower, and celebrate one another, free of judgment or critique.

We will spend the first hour sitting together in a sharing circle. The next two hours involve a meditative sound practice, using sound, breath, and voice, combined with our imagination and intention, to create a warm and nurturing sonic space that enables us to quiet our minds and venture within. From there, we can explore deeper states of consciousness.

The sounds of gongs, singing bowls, chimes, drums, and other instruments are not just heard through our ears, but are also felt by our bodies: our skin, bones, cells, and the fluids within us resonate with the sound’s vibrations. Sound can also trigger memories and emotions. Therefore, with focused listening and presence—by meditating on sound—we can work through underlying stress, release blocks, and bring ourselves into states of relaxation and well-being.

24900.name: Live DJ Freedom Flow with Lauren Taus

24902.name: Q&A with Android Jones
24902.description: Q&A with visionary artist Android Jones

24903.name: Morning Movements
24903.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 8:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 8:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 8:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 8:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 8:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 8:30 a.m. – 9:30 a.m.
24903.description:
📢Monday - Carlos Malta / Capoeira 
📢Tuesday - Sage Bova / Love Warrior Yoga
📢Wednesday - Luke Hefele / Survival Breath
📢Thursday - Eilish Davis / Movement with Mewfs
📢Friday - Tim Clark / Dhanda Yoga
📢Saturday - TBA

24904.name: Blue Monday
24904.description:
An hour of every version of New Order's "Blue Monday!"  If you have a version you love, bring it on a thumb drive. 
We may even serve a boozy blue drink.

24905.name: Hot Dashi Nights
24905.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 9:30 p.m. – 11 p.m.
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 9:30 p.m. – 11 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 9:30 p.m. – 11 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 9:30 p.m. – 11 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 9:30 p.m. – 11 p.m.
24905.description:
Come sip hot dashi with Camp DASHI! On cool desert evenings, hot dashi is just the thing to warm you up!

Dashi: Dashi is a class of soup and cooking stock used in Japanese cuisine. Dashi forms the base for miso soup, clear broth, noodle broth, and many kinds of simmering liquid.

We will offer vegan and fish based dashi.

24906.name: Bloody Mary Morning
24906.description: It's a Bloody Mary Mornin' baby! Come by The Wisco for a spicy kick in the mouth. Chill with us as we jam the greatest hits by our living God, Willie Nelson.

24907.name: Old Fashioneds, hey!
24907.description: We love  Brandy Old Fashioneds and so will you. If you don't, more for us. Join us at the Wisco Bar, in Hamster Camp, for the greatest cocktail in the universe. Stay with us for the afternoon of camp fun and body painting.

24908.name: Hobotini Friday Get down
24908.description: Come get down with the get down. Let the Wisco Bar serve you our most popular camp cocktail, The Hobotini. Cold and crisp, it'll hit the spot.  While you're in camp, let our talented camp air brush artist give you a new look.

24909.name: Decorative Shibari (bondage) Ties
24909.description: The contemporary meaning of Shibari describes an ancient Japanese artistic form of erotic rope bondage. In this beginner class we'll teach you several decorative ties that would look great as playa attire. Come solo or with a partner. We'll have rope for the first 30 participants.

24910.name: Freedom Flow Yoga with Lauren Taus

24911.name: Live DJ Freedom Flow Yoga with Lauren Taus

24913.name: Applied Tantra with Liam Pfeiffer
24913.description:
We’re in this Together - Applied Tantra w/ Liam Pfeiffer 

The challenges of these times can bring us closer instead of dividing us further. It’s up to us to find ways to become stronger instead of weaker. This class will focus on partner exercises and Venus Kriyas from Kundalini Yoga that can help us see the best in each other. Sweat, laugh, meditate deeply, and relax. Let’s affirm our solidarity in spirit for peace, uplifting all, and helping each other now.

24915.name: Unicornasana Yoga with AnneSophie Leary
24915.description: AnneSophie aka Wisemonki is a yoga teacher based in San francisco. Born in Los Angeles and raised both in LA and south of France she has found San Francisco to be her home. A yogi for ten years she has been teaching for five. Recently she has started leading deep house yoga events in both LA and SF. Her lineage is in Vinyasa and Forest yoga ( Ana Forest ). Her classes are strong , they are sweaty yet this one may be a bit dusty ;)

24916.name: Live DJ Kundalini Yoga with Yeva Don & DJ LUM
24916.description:
Kundalini yoga is one of the fastest and most powerful ways for growth and awareness.  It promotes a compassionate, more loving and patient relationship to the self and others.  The practice enables a wide and truthful view of reality, and an ability to tune into the natural flow of life. 

The lessons are easy to follow, understand, and turn into a personal daily practice, which centers, connects, and raises vibration, both individual and collective. 

Radiate, glow and magnify your intuition, as you become a magnet for better things in life, receive clarity and peace of mind, and grow confident in following your own way in with this elevating practice set to live shamanic beats.

24917.name: Yoga with Gloria Medellin
24917.description: A powerful blend of Hatha yoga and alignment with conscious meditation, pranayama and soulful words from the heart.

24918.name: DJ + Yoga + Violin with Elian, Tasha & Rebecca
24918.description: Embody and fluidly transition through ancient and novel shapes in this full mind/body/spirit journey set to deep playa tech beats, the ethereal sounds of the violin, and live vocal harmonies.

24919.name: Live DJ + Yoga with Eli Scheier and DJ Nour
24919.description: Vinyasa Yoga, translated as “arranging something in a special way,” brings a lightness, ease and relaxation to your daily playa rituals. This class is meant to re-connect you with your body, mind and soul so there’s more room for dance, play and community. Tap into the source of being.

24923.name: Ideas to potentialize philanthropic efforts
24923.description: Talk and decision-making exercise about ideas to potentialize the creation and sustainability of philanthropic efforts @ default world

24924.name: Mansion: Bunny Party
24924.description:
We’re bringing back the glory days of the Mansion lifestyle circa 1969, giving life to the nightlife empire that has made fantasies into reality, and given us more sex symbols than we can handle. But this time….it’s the Bunnies who are running the show.

Come party at our Mansion. Decadance. Fanciness. Opulence. Sexiness. Service. Way too much fun.

24925.name: I Love House Music Party
24925.description:
This is the party that we all were waiting for: The best house music from the '90s-2000s and more
Come party with us, we are A Confederacy of Dunces!
Full open bar, bring your cup and your best moves!

24926.name: Qigong for Beginners
24926.description: Stop by and learn the beginner basics of Qigong, the ancient Chinese system of movement and breath.  Begin the life-long practice that supports physical and mental health and healing.

24927.name: SPAM Appreciation
24927.description: The fine folks of Camp FUA continue to bring the culinary sophistication of SPAM to the Playa. Join the FUA SPAM stylists for SPAM-kabobs, SPAM-lore, SPAM-fashion and the melodic tones of TOM JONES! It's Not unusual to love SPAM! Camp FUA! Tom Jones! And SPAM! It's worth the trip to the outer road.

24928.name: Pickle Party – Brine It On!
24928.description: Preserve yourselves with a selection of pickle-perfect cocktails, the cold crunch of a classic big dill, and an upbeat, guilty pleasures playlist from the Sixties onward – mixed and served by boozy, briny desert darlings. Light entertainment at the bar.

24929.name: Clarity and Consent B.E.D. Playshop
24929.description:
The B.E.D. Bureau of Erotic Discourse will host a sex positive and fun playshop at Hotel California on how to playa sex, how to talk about what you want, negotiating consent, talking with playa hotties and more! Interactive, immersive, thought provoking and wildly useful, this is the ultimate playa centric sex ed for adults!  

Make consent the 11th principle! The burn can't exist unless everyone has the freedom to express themselves without fear of assault. That’s a simple fact. 
Our camp knows this and we are stepping into a leadership role to make it happen. So we are taking the Bureau of Erotic Discourse’s Safe Camp Challenge!

24930.name: Wretched Scum & Villainy Intergalactic Happy Hour
24930.description:
// Hotel California is located at 7 & E //

Space travelers, smugglers, and wayward creatures from all corners of the Galaxy: our intergalactic bar is open in your system for one night only. 

Despite the recent Emperial occupation, our spaceport is still the first and last resort of dusty conspirators from The Outer Rim to Center Camp. Stop by for some Bantha Tonic, Death Sticks, and live music. 

Droid-free environment. We don't serve their kind here.

24931.name: Dance with the Dead
24931.description:
Mexican art projects; Pyramid of the Dead, Shogyo Mujo, Xochipill, Mayan Warrior, Axolotl - Earth Guardian with Maxa Camp & Dusty Cantina unite to bring you Dance with the Dead, a Playa tribute to Dia de Los Muertos (Day of the Dead). A long standing tradition in Mexico, Day of the Dead celebrates life by adorning Catrina (sugar skull) face paint and dancing alongside our departed ancestors.

We invite you to come join this united parade. We will be offering face painting on our art car the Axolotl at 9pm at The Temple. From there we will dance and sway as the dead alongside the Mayan Warrior marching towards the Pyramid of the Dead. At the Pyramid we will host a short speaker series, DeadTalks - Reflections on Life & Death and give an offering to the Pyramid and our loved ones residing there, culminating in a dance party hosted by the 20,000 watt sound system of the Axolotl and DJ's from all over Mexico and more. Come celebrate life with us by dancing with our dead!

24932.name: Butt-Cheeky Run
24932.description: Come get your burn started – with the sun’s soft caresses on your butt cheeks! The Ancient Greeks always trained and competed naked – in fact the ’gym’ comes from the word ‘gymnos’, meaning ‘naked’ in Greek. Come experience the freedom of running together in the altogether! Or at least come and see what a great spectator sport it is:) We’ll do a warm-up at the camp and then run wild in the ‘hood and all the way to the Man!

24933.name: Naked Oil Wrestling
24933.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 3 p.m. – 4:30 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 3 p.m. – 4:30 p.m.
Saturday, September 2nd, 2017 3 p.m. – 4:30 p.m.
24933.description: Wrestling is one of the most fun sports you can ever try. It’s also one of humanity’s oldest and was among the major events of the original Olympics. Long before we were kicking balls around we were rolling around in the dirt, putting each other in headlocks! It doesn’t matter if you’re a complete novice who’s never tried it in your life or an experienced fighter, come along and experience this amazing bonding experience in Gymnasium, Black Rock City’s Ancient Greek wrestling school!

24934.name: Discus-ish Throw in the dark… and in the buff
24934.time:
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 8 p.m. – 9 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 8 p.m. – 9 p.m.
24934.description: Discus (well, LED-lit frisbee) throw competition followed by ultimate frisbee game (or regular frisbee, depending on the mood). Bare your body, but wear lights! The Ancient Greeks always trained and competed naked – in fact the ’gym’ comes from the word ‘gymnos’, meaning ‘naked’ in Greek. Come experience the amazing freedom of running and jumping and exercising free of clothing! Or at least come and see what a great spectator sport it is:) This is our only night event, but don’t worry about cold – movement will keep you warm!

24935.name: Naked Piggy-Back and Wheelbarrow Run Race
24935.description: are with us for this fun athletic event! Bring your friends, but choose wisely, as you’ll have to bear them on your back, bareback… or vice versa. Great bonding experience guaranteed! The Ancient Greeks always trained and competed naked – in fact the ’gym’ comes from the word ‘gymnos’, meaning ‘naked’ in Greek. Come experience the amazing freedom of running and jumping and exercising free of clothing! Or at least come and see what a great spectator sport it is:) PS In ancient Olympics this would have been an equestrian event, but BMORG wouldn’t let us bring horses…

24936.name: Forró Dance Class
24936.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 12:30 p.m. – 2 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 12:30 p.m. – 2 p.m.
24936.description: Come experience Brazil's most popular partner dance and learn the basic step and the first movements. Lose yourself in the music and in a sensual embrace with somebody you might have just met. No need to come with a partner, we will swap. Forró originated from Brazil’s poor Northeastern countryside hence its informal, playful tradition.

24937.name: Naked Philosophy
24937.time:
Monday, August 28th, 2017 6 p.m. – 7:15 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 6 p.m. – 7:15 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 6 p.m. – 7:15 p.m.
24937.description: Nudity has the power to surprise and shock, yet why, on reflection, can something as mundane as the naked body inspire simultaneously so much passion and revulsion? To be naked in 21st century western society demands intense self-examination, the questioning and reappraisal of conventional conventions and morality. In this sense, naturism, as the cultural and political movement of nudism is often known, is an inherently philosophical practice. And what better way to do philosophy than naked? We’re sure your college seminars would have been much more fun nude. Come and join us for lively discussions, debates and story-telling. We’ll be discussing naturism, body image, sharing experiences, debating body modification, if and how laws should be changed – really everything related to the human body.

24938.name: Live Music w/ Christopher Worth
24938.description: Come by and listen to the sultry sounds of Worth!

24939.name: FEMALING OUR FUTURE
24939.description:
Urgent action is needed because our planet is in peril. To alter its unsustainable trajectory, women, grateful for men’s guidance, thus far, NOW must take over!  

I am spearheading the feminine power revolution, changing the paradigm.  With 45 yearsʻ experience as a political activist in the progressive, womenʻs rights, environmental and health arenas; 40 yearsʻ studying and teaching meditation and martial arts; and successful careers in performing and travel (world-wide), fashion (Paris), food (Hong Kong), and education (New York and Maui), I am seeding the awareness required to extract our society from servitude (to banks, corporations and demagogues) and to redirect it toward service, and a radiant horizon of planetary well-being and conscious decision-making.

Our testosterone-driven “leadership by domination” has resulted in: irreversible climate change, international policies of conquest, unprecedented concentration of wealth (a caste society), corporate contamination of our food supply and idolization of conspicuous consumption.  We are on the verge of the next planetary extinction event.  Meanwhile, the 99%, glued to government-manipulated media, wallows in wanton complacency.  

Now, women are rising up and re-taking the reins. Because of our biochemical makeup, we are scientifically proven to be more compassionate and less aggressive (the vast majority of all past and current peaceful societies are “matriarchal”).  
I propose an end to complacency, and offer a passionate call to action.  Women, break free from the patriarchal bondage of gender stereotyping and join our sisters, altering the planetʻs future!  Otherwise, there may not be one.

24941.name: Rock Divination
24941.description: Shamanic culture - not just in Africa but everywhere - have always used divination in  highly practical ways.  The answers to the secrets of the universe are inherent in all things - even a rock.  Nature will reveal them in an infinite number of ways if we only look there for answers. Limit: first 10 people please.

24944.description: From a direct connection to the source, we will reclaim our wild nature and connect with the creativity of our erotic spirit. "

24946.name: Burn the WORD
24946.description: On Friday morning, as the sun is rising, we will burn the WORD.  Burning scripture is widely considered an act of sacrilege and the intention here is to deeply honor the underlying message of scripture while challenging the observer to consider the common essence behind all spiritual identity.  Out of respect for the religious traditions represented in the scripture, the layer of scripture will be removed from the letters before burning.  It will be packaged and respectfully buried outside of Burning Man.  The naked word itself will be burned as we aspire to come to a deeper sense of being and spiritual identity that cannot be conveyed with words.

24947.name: Live DJ + Yoga with Lauren Taus & CSTRO
24947.description: A vinyasa flow designed to inspire love and adventure. This movement practice is about deepening your connection with your heart center so that you can be more present with others in this wild ride of human experience. Expect to move, feel, and fly, then relax back into the truth of who you really are. Class will close with a short, yoga nidra meditation.

24948.name: Freedom To Fly Yoga with Lauren Taus
24948.description: A morning vinyasa flow focused on inversions. This is an open level class focused on positive possibilities. Your body is your best teacher. Listen closely. Explore more. Change your perspective. Discover you.

24949.name: Didgeridoo Immersion with Tyler Sussman
24949.description: Experience aspects of sound and how it affects the mind, body and spirit. Learn how to relax and meditate in sound: Immerse yourself in the frequencies of different instruments, breath, and movement, and partake in group discussions on how to integrate your experience into daily life for health, happiness and wellbeing.

24950.name: Slow Dance
24950.description: Imagine the soft, slow swaying last dance at a high school prom. Soft, quiet, romantic DJ music from the 30's and 40's. We will have a dance after a quick 10 minute introduction class. No experience required. No partner required. Everyone dances. The music is low and the dance is slow, allowing dancers to have a conversation while dancing.  Exchange favorite playa stories, and meet 30 to 40 new burners. A great way to end (or start) the evening on the playa.

24951.name: Introduction to Waltzing

Learn the basic waltz step, and basic social couples introductory dance skills such as frame, balance, and timing. No prior dance experience needed. No partner needed, as we rotate rapidly in class. Waltz practice with one on one help after the class.

24952.name: Beginning Social Couple Dancing
24952.description: Come learn the basics of social couple dancing.  You will learn introductory dance skills such as frame, balance, and timing.  We will then branch out into learning the basic steps of waltz, polka and one step dancing.  No prior dance experienced needed.  No partner needed. One on one help available after the class.

Bring a few of your favorite brews and squeeze into our tiny bar with the Giant Jenga of Death.

Don't have beer to bring, come anyway. If you attempt the Giant Jenga of Death, we'll give you a beer.

Steel toed shoes are recommended.

Come get your effigy on! Make & Take your own mini effigy to burn Sunday morning at the man site. Radically create your ritual effigy with our burnable baubles! Make art with old friends and new and burn it! We will have 7" palm plates as a foundation and you can build your effigy using popsicle sticks, spools, matches, clothespins, letters, buttons and more! Bring something of your own that is burnable and follows the guidelines to incorporate into your mini effigy. 

As Larry Says: "This year we invite participants to create their own burning woman or man. Our theme is Radical Ritual, and what could be more appropriate than to reenact the ritual that founded Burning Man? These figures may be constructed prior to the event, but perhaps an even better option is to craft one in your camp."

You may not have what it takes to craft one in your camp, so come get crafty in ours and make your best effigy ever!

24966.name: James Joyce - Finnegan Wakes on the Playa 2017
24966.time:
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017 6 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Wednesday, August 30th, 2017 6 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Thursday, August 31st, 2017 6 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Friday, September 1st, 2017 6 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
24966.description:
Help us re-awaken mythical giant Tim Finnegan, the archetypal Everyman from James Joyce's epic novel Finnegans Wake.  We are asking Burners to radically participate on the Playa in 2017 by reading a single page from Chapter 6 of Joyce's masterpiece on camera.

This will be our second year filming a chapter of Wake at Burning Man. In 2016, we filmed 121 Burners perform chapter 7 (Shem the Penman) of Wake. Here are a few short clips from last year's episode:

https://youtu.be/50hbiUY87W0

Please choose the page you'd like to perform this year from chapter 6 of FW at this link:

http://www.finwake.com/1024chapter6/1024finn6.htm

You can also bring along your favorite piece of music on your phone to accompany your reading if you like, and we will run the audio for your performance thru our mixer.

The final goal of our Finnegan Wakes project is to provide the world with the first ever complete edition of Finnegans Wake on film, performed by Burners from around the world.

We'll be posting updates at the FB group in this posting regarding when and where we'll be filming performances around BRC so please join the FB group for updates. This year, Finnegans Wake on the Playa will be based in the Dream-Land of Camp Fuego at 6:15 and H.

The complete episode (chapter 7) from 2016 can be viewed here:
https://youtu.be/yReE0yoVTSE

25008.description: Being so fully present in all of our being, and so lit up from within, that we feel full and fully taken care of by life. - A Talk with Udo Erasmus

25009.name: Pink Floyd Ecstatic Dance
25009.description:
Through the gates of dawn to the endless river, take a journey through time and space as we immerse ourselves in a flow of instrumental excerpts from over 40 years of the Pink Floyd discography.  Be inspired to dance and meditate, release your inner animal and break through your walls. From the dark side of the moon to the heart of the sun, the tiniest atom to the great interstellar expanse, the pulse of life to the great beyond, let us leave behind our divisions.  The eclipse brings darkness, yet the light ever returns.  We will always shine on, my bright ambassadors!  When the time comes, my only thought will be, I wish you were here.  ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ 
A note from the arranger:  This has been a project long in the making.  I have often felt the call of the dance from Pink Floyd’s music, momentary spans from so many different songs that called out to be joined together in one great epic track.  What you will hear has been carefully selected, shaped and spliced together to create a seamless experience, from a meditative beginning, ever amplified with a gentle rise in intensity, until we reach a riotous celebration of life and energy at the peak.   Like life itself, we release completely, winding down to a great finality.  What is at the end of our journey?  Have we lived our lives as completely and fully as we ever desired, as we look back from that long road?  We can only answer these questions for ourselves.  I invite you to take this opportunity to reflect on these things, and be yourself, as completely and fully as possible.   Let us live in a world we call can share.  With Love, Blue Jay
